message.content: This question is asking us to determine when it will require more strength to push a little kid on a swing. We need to understand the concept of weight and how it relates to strength. As a person grows older, they typically gain weight and become heavier. Therefore, as the little kid grows older and heavier, it will require more strength to push them on the swing. Option (A) is incorrect because losing weight would make the kid lighter and therefore require less strength. Option (B) is unrelated to the concept of weight and strength. Option (C), seventy four plus five, is a random mathematical equation and has no correlation to the question.

This question requires knowledge about the concept of weight and how it affects the force required to move an object. When the little kid grows older, they will naturally become heavier. The force required to push an object is directly proportional to its weight. Therefore, as the kid gets older and gains weight, it will require more strength to push him on the swing. Option (A) is incorrect because losing weight would make the kid lighter and therefore easier to push. Option (B) is unrelated to the weight of the child. Option (C) is a math problem unrelated to the weight of the child.

As a child grows older, they tend to gain weight and therefore their mass increases. The greater the mass of an object, the more force is required to move it. Therefore, as the child grows older and becomes heavier, it will require more strength to push them on the swing.
